snippet: Mattel said slow sales of Barbie, Hot Wheels and the costs tied to the acquisition of HIT Entertainment hurt its results, which are typically down in the first quarter of the year for toy companies.
abstract: Mattel says slow toy sales and costs of buying HIT Entertainment hurts results; first-quarter profit was $7.8 million, or 2 cents a share, down 53 percent from $16.6 million, or 5 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue was $928.4 million, down 3 percent from $951.9 million.
lead_paragraph: Mattel said slow sales of Barbie, Hot Wheels and the costs tied to the acquisition of HIT Entertainment hurt its results, which are typically down in the first quarter of the year for toy companies.

headline.main: In Season of Slow Toy Sales, Mattel’s Profit Plunges 53%
headline.print_headline: In Season of Slow Toy Sales, Mattel’s Profit Plunges 53%
